Class "OneInColTable"

Source: R/OneInColTable.R
OneInColTable-class.Rd

Abstract class OneInColTable is responsible for creating assessment task according to QTI 2.1. with table of answer options, where only one right answer in each colum is possible

Slots

content

list; list of strings with formatting to form the text of the question

identifier

string; identifier of assessment task

title

string; a title of xml file

prompt

string, optional; simple question text, consisting of one paragraph, can supplement or replace content

qti_version

string; QTI information model version; default 'v2p1

feedback

list of ModalFeedback, CorrectFeedback, or WrongFeedback; feedback messages for candidate

rows

string vector; sets answer options as row names in table or the firsts elements in couples in directed pairs

rows_identifiers

string vector; sets identifiers for answer options defined in rows of table or identifiers of the firsts elements in couples in directed pairs

cols

string vector; sets answer options as cols headers in table or the seconds elements in couples in directed pairs

cols_identifiers

string vector; sets identifiers for answer options defined in cols of table or identifiers of the seconds elements in couples in directed pairs

answers_identifiers

string vector; sets couples of identifiers that combine the right answers

answers_scores

numeric vector, optional; each number in this vector determines the number of points that will be awarded to a candidate if he selects the corresponding answer; if nothing assign as answers_scores, the individual values for right answers calculates from task points and number of right options

shuffle

boolean, optional; is responsible to randomize the order in which the choices are initially presented to the candidate; default TRUE

shuffle_rows

boolean, optional; to randomize the order of the choices only in rows; default TRUE

shuffle_cols

boolean, optional; to randomize the order of the choices only in columns; default TRUE

points

numeric, optional; the number of points for the entire task; default 1

Note

use create_qti_task() to create an xml file of a task specification

Examples

mt <- new("OneInColTable", content = list("<p>\"One in col\" table task</p>",
                                                "<i>table description</i>"),
          rows = c("row1", "row2", "row3", "row4"),
          rows_identifiers = c("a", "b", "c", "d"),
          cols = c("alfa", "beta", "gamma"),
          cols_identifiers = c("k", "l", "m"),
          answers_identifiers = c("a k", "d l", 'd m'),
          points = 5,
          title = "oneincol_choice_table",
          identifier = "oneincol_table_example")
